Reviews.Title: “Convinient location.”
Reviews.Author: Christina023
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small but cosy. The stuff was really friendly and the rooms were nice. The bed was very confortable. The bathroom was ok but a renovation wouldnt be such a bad idea. Breakfast was good. It had cakes, eggs, croissant, cheese, ham, milk, variety of yogurt, cereal. What more can anyone ask for? The hotel is just a block away from the Termini station (2 minutes walk) which makes moving around the city really easy. Next to the metro & the bus station. Termini is also the drop off point of buses from and to the Ciampini airport. So really convinient. I would definetely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Cotecicotela
Reviews.Content: location is good for short stay. Rooms are typical, but they have a crazy system of using the cable TV and Wifi. Be carefull on getting overcharged on your mobile phone, as the Wifi is not free. You can go to the Roma Termini to find a free Wifi hot spot. Breakfast was the worst during my entire time in Itlay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: DonCar65
Reviews.Content: Arrived Rome Oct 2010 and went directly to hotel from the Termini. The overall experience wasn't entirely unsatisfactory, however, the area where the Marconi is located is 2 blocks from Rome Termini and is not the most desirable area to be in. The receptionist (man) wasn't at all friendly. Hotel could use some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but average hotel and poor staff”
Reviews.Author: jennypenny12
Reviews.Content: We had to stay here when our itinerary changed, so we found vacancy at the Marconi on the fly. The receptionist was a real piece of work. He was very unfriendly and almost annoyed that we wanted to stay there for the evening. He said 3 things to us while we were there...the price per night for a room, the fact that he needed our credit card and passport, and then what room number we were in. We were basically on our own from there. They claim to have free wifi, but it doesn't work (or we couldn't get to work with the help of the front desk, but with no avail), and they taut air conditioning in the rooms, but the hotel controls the thermostat. However, the one of the few things they have going for them is that it is a great location. A 5-minute walk to the train station and very close to the Roman National Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: osc_1
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at Marconi Hotel for 3 nites, superb location, literally mins from the Termini, we had paid a transfer fee of £65.00 (for us both - return) from the airport to the hotel, however, when arriving at airport we could have paid only 8 euros each, return, to get to the termini, which really is so close. Transport is so easy in Rome. The hotel was immaculately clean and tidy and reception staff very helpful. The map in Reception is a must have. The restaurant / pizzeria opposite the hotel on the corner is AMAZING, we had the nicest food there, and also found it to be the cheapest for food and drink! You can sit inside or out, and the staff were wonderful. Thoroughly enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rich-Tracy
Reviews.Content: I have started to use trip advisor alot for hotel information etc but have never written a review before. We stayed for 3 nights January 2011. Marconi hotel itself is in a great location only about 10 mins walk from the Colleseum. The room was fairly big and clean but could have done with some general cosmetic work and the view from the window was a wall and someones parking space but then again the location more than made up for it. Tea and coffee making facilities (kettle and fridge) were a nice touch but the mini bar was very expensive, there is a shop less than a minute away from the hotel where water etc is only 30p for 2 litres rather than the 2 euros for 500ml (hotel price). We only stayed bed and breakfast and found the choices available for breakfast very good, cereal, bread, pastries, eggs, sausages, chips!!!!!!! lol fresh honey (you cut it off the honeycomb), fruit, yohurts and juices, coffee, tea etc. The tranfer from the airport was about 100 euros return (i think that the hotel is about 30 km away) and the taxis do appear to have set prices. Sight seeing- Rome is not a very well signposted city but a map was available free of charge from the hotel. As the weather was nice we walked to the Vatican (it took about an hour) but there were lots of things to see along the way. The Trevi fountain and Spanish steps should def not be missed and the street entertainers on a night were fantastic. I would recommend taking a DVD or book to unwind with after a day of sight seeing as although the hotel has sattelite TV with over 300 channels there was only 1 english speaking news channel (CNN i think) and a couple of music channels. A new charge from the government came in last summer and a charge of 2 euros per night per person is payable on check out.

Reviews.Title: “just a great choice ...”
Reviews.Author: 8sagittarius
Reviews.Content: we are a group of 9 people and all of us are of the opinion that this hotel was an absolutely right choice. Very helpful and polite stuff (Roberta is super) ! owing to the volcano ash clouds we needed their help and we apreciate that they were ALWAYS there for us. Rooms were great! very comfortable and clear. Hotel marconi is very close to the central transport station so the location was really convenient for us. Most of all, breakfast was very good with a big variety !! we'll come back soon .. :D

Reviews.Title: “Not honest about internet connection & air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: 100CountryGoal
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for three reasons (1) location, (2) air conditioning, and (3) having an internet connection. The hotel's web site notes that every room has air conditioning and an internet connection. The hotel has NO internet connections in ANY room. The receptionist noted that each room has a phone jack, from which you can "connect" to the internet. I do not believe most people consider a phone line as an "internet connection". If you do, then disregard my comment. If you don't, then disregard this hotel! Secondly, I never experienced any air conditioning, despite several requests. Finally, about my third inquiry, the reception noted that the air conditioning was controlled centrally and only operated for a few hours. . . I believe he said 3-5 pm, 11:30 pm to 1:30 am, and 6 to 8 am, or something like that. However, even during those hours, there was no cold air coming out of my vents. Fortunately it was not extremely hot outside, but it was uncomfortable. Finally, the reception was simply not polite. Before any problems arose, there was never as much as a smile. That's no big deal, but the people were down-right rude once I complained about the room being very hot and there being no internet connection. Location was decent, and there were no major cleanliness problems, although there was a musty smell (especially in the hallways) and the hotel has an old feel to it. Overall, I feel that the hotel is misleading people into staying at the hotel by not being honest about having internet connections and (at least adequate) air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the train station but little else”
Reviews.Author: locutus243
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Marconi is placed wonderfully round the corner from the train station and therefore also within just a few minutes walk to Rome's tube system. The room was ok, a little small but generally pleasant enough, although it could have been a little cleaner. The staff were not polite, and didn't really seem to have much time for guests. This included reception to whom we always came across an inconvenience and the women who would make as much noise as possible in the breakfast room disturbing anybody who may be eating there. The breakfast was a typical continental selection with meats, cheeses, yoghurts and such, but none of this was particularly fresh, the bread being decidedly stale and tough. Despite my comments, I would recommend this hotel for people looking for a simple bed and breakfast in Rome because of its good value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: TottyMoto
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in the Marconi in August 2008 and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. If you have money to spare you would probably prefer to stay somewhere more central as the termini area is a bit "rough", although not half as bad as some people have described and I never felt unsafe. We booked with Hotel Connect and got 5 nights for £240.00 (bed and breakfast at Marconi) - absolute bargain. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from the termini and 20 minute walk from the Colossuem. We hardly ever used the metro as is was so nice to walk everywhere. The Marconi was very clean, and the staff very helpful when we asked any questions. The room was not too small either and the bathrroms looked quite new. It has tea/coffee making facilities, a safe, a hairdryer, TV, radio and a mini fridge which is a great touch - we bought drinks from local stores and stored them to keep cool. the drinks they supply in the mini fridge were about 2 Euro each - which actually is not bad considering prices in Rome generally! The air-con worked and there was plenty of wardrobe/drawer space for clothes etc. Beds perfectly comfy and we never had any problems with noise from other guests or outside. Also they supply great maps of Rome for free in reception- better than any of the ones the guide books we bought had. Breakfasts were good - bread, croissants, youghurt, cereal, fruit, tea, coffee, juice, ham, cheese - what more could you want.? I would absolutely reccomend Marconi Hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fearing the”
Reviews.Author: Jd3Uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a one night break en route to elsewhere. Hotel was clean, beds comfortable, aircon good and even though we were on the first floor excellent double glazing blocked out any traffic noise. Having been to Rome a couple of times before I was a bit dubious about staying so close to the station but there was no need as the area felt perfectly safe. Room itself was dark (in Pais that would be "charming") but adequate and was pleasantly surprised by minibar, safe in room and bath. If I wanted somewhere to stay in Rome for a reasonable price to use as a base and a decent night's sleep then I would definitely choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good comfortable 3*”
Reviews.Author: LeroyWirral
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel the Marconi was very good. Very clean, good size rooms with a safe in the room which is a must in Rome so you can leave some money/credit cards behind when you go out for the day. Was concerned about some of the reports of noise and the Terminii area being rough but the hotel is only a short walk from the Terminii which is great as a tourist because it means you can get around very easy. Stayed for 5 days towards end of February and we did see some beggars but no more than in the rest of Rome. Didn't come across any incidents with Pickpockets or Gypsies. Breakfast was very good with a good selection and if certain foods ran out they were always replenished promptly. Good restaurant, frequented by locals, just around the corner if you don't want to travel too far in the evening. Would stay there again, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for seeing Rome”
Reviews.Author: southboundman
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a four night stay at the Marconi Hotel in Rome and was well impressed with the interior of this 3 star establishment. The staff were very courtious and very helpful with everything and also spoke very good english. The hotel has been recently decorated and has around 40 rooms covering the first two floors of the building. The room itself was what you would expect of a 3 star hotel and it included tea and coffee making facilites, hairdryer, TV and a small fridge which is brill for having that bottle of wine or pint of milk. There is also a free safe deposit box in all the rooms. The breakfast was continental buffet with ample food to set you up for the day. There are also two excellent restaurants on the corner of the building which is great after a long tiring day walking about Rome. All in all, a very pleasant hotel stay, and it is conveniently situated one street away from the main Termini station which is the dropoff point for most coaches from Ciampino airport. I would most likely stay here again if returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SlymanChicago
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, excellent location. Very good breakfast (meats, cheeses, cereal, eggs, juices, bakery items etc.), immaculate room and bath with a private safe in room. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Hotel on a nasty noisy street”
Reviews.Author: BoxsterRichSD
Reviews.Content: You wouldn't want to have this as a base of operations in my opinion as the neigborhood is pretty gross and traffic and constant car horns (like 30 blowing all at the same time) are kind of annoying. We found it perfect though though to come in from Cinque Terre in the evening as the train station is a block away and grab the airport train the next am. Room was nice, clean and staff fine and the price very fair on internet . Can't comment on the breakfast as we had to leave before that. I would check out neighborhoods near the Spanish Steps for a longer stay as this train station ilke any , makes for a grimy neighborhood and you won't get the true flaver of Rome. A few years ago I stayed at a R. Steves fav "Hotel Nardizi Americano" which I thought was very nice and central and I notice he still loves it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel a block from Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: M&J_BR
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, this is hotels resembles an american chain hotel, like a Best Western or Holliday Inn. Very professional and clean, with good instalations and breakfeast. The room and the bathroom were both big and spacious. Also well kept and clean. The location is not the most charming in Rome, but great for those arriving or leaving by trais, or to cath the Leonardo Express to Fiumiccino airport. Conclusion: I would stay there again if had a short time in Rome or where on business. In a honeymoon, I would look for a more exciting location. Paid 120EUR, but could have paid 100EUR if booked 48 hours in advance through the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: LoveTOtravel17
Reviews.Content: Just back after 5 days in Rome - this hotel is practically on the doorstep of Termini.Very clean hotel, great breakfast, towels changed and room cleaned every day. No large reception and no bar area, but if you are in Rome to see the sights, it won't matter. I came back exhausted every night after all the walking!! There is a bus for 5 euro from Ciampino which leaves you off at Termini. Not great for the return journey though as it only goes every few hours. The best tour bus to get is definitely the red 110 - 13 euro and does all the major sites - don't go on the greeny, its nowhere near as good. We have been wearing t-shirts all week as the weather has been gorgeous. Comfortable shoes essential and a foot spray a must at the end of the day! The pizza/pasta place next door is excellent and very good value for money. If you are in the area of the colesseum and don't mind spending a bit extra - Pasqualinas is excellent - great staff - wonderful food and a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “marconi”
Reviews.Author: mike6363
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in November. Great location, everything is within walking distance. Large room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: syba
Reviews.Content: My grandson & I spent 4 nights at Hotel Marconi. It is conveniently situated close to Termini Station, so access to important sites is easy. The rooms were clean & comfortable. Breakfast was buffet style & a good choice. Staff were helpful & spoke good English. Good value for money if you are looking for basic accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: JosetteG
Reviews.Content: Just been back from the Hotel Marconi in Rome. It was a pleasant six-day stay. We had a lovely room. Good buffet breakfast. Very very close to Termini Station. No noise of trains or buses is heard from the room. Hotel recommended! I will definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Spuddysbabe
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for a city break from Monday to Friday and really enjoyed it. The hotel is in a great location being by the Termini Station (easy access to the metro) and very easy to get to when you fly into Fiumicino airport. (If you do get the train from the airport which costs 9 euros, when you leave the station make sure you leave it right at the very top of the station and not half way down or you will get lost !) Our room was a side room and was a decent size. The only problem we had was on the first night there was someone extremely noisy above us. The Marconi Hotel occupies only the first 2 floors of the building and it is a different hotel on the floor above - we found this odd but apparentley it is very common in Rome. The room was nice and clean, the bed sheets were lovely crisp white and clean and the towels were changed every day. The breakfast was a cold buffet with cereal, bread, cheese, hams, jams, croissants etc, and a toaster. The breakfast room was in a nice sunny side of the building and the tables were nice and clean. We had evening meal every night in the restaurant just on the corner of the building (can't remember the name of it but is a pasta and pizza place) which was fairly cheap and the food was outstanding every night. I wouldn't go walking around too much on a night in this area as there were a few undesirables about, but we were so tired from our days, we didn't get back till about 6/7pm every night and after a shower and tea about 9pm we were ready for bed anyway !! I would reccommend this hotel to couples as a great base for a wonderful stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Marconi Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our choice. Excellent location - only a few minutes from Termini and the buses. Room clean and spacious; quiet, too, with an inside window to another slice of Rome life in the inner courtyard. Breakfast OK, staff very courteous and with good English. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel to all Places of Interest”
Reviews.Author: Kienan
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Monday to Friday. Weather was very hot. Hotel was very central to buses, trains and metro. Bus dropped from airport to Termini - 8euros single trip - approx 40 min journey. Then from Termini it was a two minute walk to the hotel. Hotel was clean and kept very tidy. Room was cleaned every morning and towels changed each day. Electronic safe in room to secure our passports etc. Continental breakfast was served in spotless dining room between 7.30 - 10am, plenty of choice of food. Staff friendly and spoke English. Were helpful in showing directions to locations. Street very busy with people but we did not encounter any problems. Hotel was very central to all places of interest. I will be visiting Rome again and would definitely consider staying in Hotel Marconi.
